header_summary:
The Quantum‑Resistant Address Migration Protocol (QRAMP) introduces a novel approach to enhancing post-quantum security by placing legacy Unspent Transaction Outputs (UTXOs) in a quarantine mode, facilitating a two-phase commit and spend flow to prevent destination substitution. This method incorporates a commitment phase that requires on-chain publication and a spend phase that demands proof of a matching commitment, addressing potential technical challenges without the need for historical transaction data lookups. The mechanism also includes fee sponsorship to improve user experience, as detailed in the provided [design note](https://github.com/bnavf/bitcoinqp/blob/main/two_phase_destination_commitment.md) and [diagram](https://github.com/bnavf/bitcoinqp/blob/main/two_phase_destination_commitment.svg).

In another domain, the simplex algorithm's application in linear programming is clarified, emphasizing the correct number of equations needed for determining basic variables and highlighting the importance of not mistaking the optimization target as a variable. This adjustment is vital for the accurate application of the algorithm in optimization problems, as further explained in the accompanying [source](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/spanning-forest-cluster-linearization/1419/11).

Furthermore, discussions around managing payment tweaks in blockchain transactions underscore the operational challenges of verifying tweak data, debating the merits of minimal message formats versus enhanced DoS resistance. This dialogue points to a critical decision-making juncture for transaction management, elaborated on in a [previous reply](https://gist.github.com/setavenger/a0cd7e71b47ded9fca9c99085130cf2a?permalink_comment_id=5931734gistcomment-5931734).

Lastly, the integration of notifications into the Silent Payments protocol through Nostr marks a significant step forward in digital transactions, aiming to improve user experience by fostering a more interactive and responsive transaction environment. This effort towards merging financial technology with communication platforms is documented for further exploration and contribution on [DelvingBitcoin](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/silent-payments-notifications-via-nostr/2203).

recent_posts.title: QRAMP addition: Alternative to legacy freeze: “quarantine-mode” legacy spends via two-phase destination commitment
recent_posts.summary:
- QRAMP introduces quarantine mode for legacy UTXOs, enabling post-quantum spend with a new commit phase.
- The mechanism avoids destination substitution and requires consensus-enforced SPV-style inclusion proof for transaction commits.
- It proposes fee sponsorship for the commitment transaction, allowing service providers to cover fees.

recent_posts.title: Spanning-forest cluster linearization
recent_posts.summary:
- The simplex algorithm solves optimization problems, initially setting n-1 variables to zero.
- It accurately uses m+1 equations, not m+2, for determining basic variables.
- The optimization target and goal function are crucial but not counted as equations.

today_in_history_posts.summary:

today_in_history_posts.summary:
